page.title: 10Electrification, East Region
page.content: Some years ago British Rail decided to electrify the track from Colchester to Norwich and Harwich. They had to change the lines because they curved too much for fast trains and come off the tracks. They had to heighten the bridges so the electric wires would fit under for the electric trains. The semaphore signals were changed for colour light signalling when the electric trains started to go. British Rail dug holes and poured cement in them to support the posts which were put up for the wires. Ipswich Station has been painted and improved and new timetable indicators which look like televisions have been put up give you up to minute inform- ation about trains. On May 13th electric trains started to go from London to Ipswich. Kane Bailey,age 10.Hillside C.P. Sch.
